discussion.content:
The correct anwer is B.
100 mW = 20dBm
Then 20 dBm - 3 dBm = 100 mW/2 ----> 17 dBm =50 mW

questions.question_text: What is the numerical value in dBm that corresponds to a power level of 50 mW?

discussion.content: C - I always thought it was Lobby Admin

questions.question_text: A wireless network administartor wants an employee to be able to create guest user accounts on the WLC, without having access to other features. Which type of account must be created?

choices.C: It improves the SNR by focusing the signal transmission to the client
choices.B: It moves the wireless signal automatically to different channels when there is high utilization
choices.D: It balances the traffic load by distributing clients across different access points
choices.A: It increases the RF coverage of the access points

discussion.content: I agree. Beamforming is a technique that focuses a wireless signal towards a specific receiving device, rather than having the signal spread in all directions from a broadcast antenna, as it normally would. The resulting more direct connection is faster and more reliable than it would be without beamforming.
I think C is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: Which statement about beamforming on a wireless network is true?

choices.E: For every gain of 3 dB, divide the transmit power mW by 2
choices.B: For every gain of 10 dB, multiply the transmit power mW by 100
choices.A: For every gain of 3 db, multiply the transmit power mW by 2
choices.D: For every loss of 30 dB, decrease the transmit power mW by 1000
choices.C: For every loss of 30 dB, multiply the transmit power mW by 1000

discussion.content:
This is stange:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/wireless-mobility/wireless-lan-wlan/23231-powervalues-23231.html

An Increase of:
3 dB Double transmit power
10 dB 10 times the transmit power
30 dB 1000 times the transmit power

A Decrease of:
3 dB Half transmit power
10 dB Divides transmit power by 10
30 dB 1000 times the transmit power

A is ok, but all other is wrong. why e?

comments.content: No, D is not correct. You need to divide the power by 1000mw not decrease.
